clinical_study.brief_title: A Survey on Hypoglycaemia Among Insulin-treated Patients With Diabetes
clinical_study.official_title: A Survey on Hypoglycaemia Among Insulin-treated Patients With Diabetes

brief_summary.textblock: This survey is conducted in South America. The aim of this survey is to investigate hypoglycaemia among Insulin-treated patients with diabetes.

primary_outcome.measure: The percentage of patients experiencing at least 1 hypoglycaemic event

secondary_outcome.time_frame: In the 6 months prior to (Part 1 SAQ, Self-Assessment questionnaire) and 4 weeks following (Part 2 SAQ) the baseline visit
In the 6 months prior to (Part 1 SAQ) and 4 weeks following (Part 2 SAQ) the baseline visit
In the 4 weeks prior to (Part 1 SAQ) and 4 weeks following (Part 2 SAQ) the baseline visit
In the 4 weeks prior to (Part 1 SAQ) and following (Part 2 SAQ) the baseline visit
In the 4 weeks following the baseline visit (Patient Diary)

secondary_outcome.measure: Hypoglycaemic events associated with a blood glucose measurement below 56 mg/dL irrespective of symptoms
secondary_outcome.time_frame: In the 4 weeks following the baseline visit (Patient Diary)
In the 4 weeks prior to (Part 1 SAQ) and 4 weeks following (Part 2 SAQ) the baseline visit

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in the reported incidence rates of hypoglycaemia
secondary_outcome.time_frame: In the 4 weeks prior to (Part 1 SAQ) versus 4 weeks following (Part 2 SAQ) the baseline visit

intervention.description: Two different questionnaires will be applied to patients during a regular clinical visit.

study_pop.textblock: Twenty-five sites will be selected, distributed in different regions of the country, in order to be representative of the Brazilian population.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Informed consent obtained before any study-related activities
- The following patients will be considered eligible for inclusion in the study: Patients with T1DM (Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus) or T2DM (Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus) treated with insulin for more than 12 months and patients at least 18 years of age at the time of the survey
Exclusion Criteria:
- Mental incapacity, unwillingness or language barriers precluding adequate understanding or cooperation
- Illiterate patients and patients otherwise unable to complete a written survey
- Non-ambulatory patients
- Simultaneous participation in any other clinical study with an investigational product
